briefdescription.para: The drawables at the center of the scroll wheel.
The drawables at the beginning and end of the scroll wheel.
List of drawables in firsts.
The distance after selected item.
The distance before selected item.
The center list.
The list for items not in the center.
The distance after selected item.
The distance before selected item.
The original update center drawable callback.
The original update drawable callback.
Gets selected item extra size after.

simplesect.para: The selected item extra size after.

briefdescription.para: Gets selected item extra size before.

simplesect.para: The selected item extra size before.

briefdescription.para: Gets selected item margin after.
Gets selected item margin before.
Removed all drawables and initializes the content of these items.
Inform the scroll list that the contents of an item has changed and force all drawables with the given item index to be updated via the callback provided.

detaileddescription.para: This is important as a circular list with very few items might display the same item more than once and all these items should be updated.

parameterdescription.para: Zero-based index of the changed item.

briefdescription.para: Sets whether the list is circular (infinite) or not.

detaileddescription.para: A circular list is a list where the first drawable re-appears after the last item in the list - and the last item in the list appears before the first item in the list.

parameterdescription.para: True if the list should be circular, false if the list should not be circular.

memberdef.argsstring: (DrawableListItemsInterface &drawableListItems, GenericCallback< DrawableListItemsInterface *, int16_t, int16_t > &updateDrawableCallback, DrawableListItemsInterface &centerDrawableListItems, GenericCallback< DrawableListItemsInterface *, int16_t, int16_t > &updateCenterDrawableCallback)
memberdef.name: setDrawables

briefdescription.para: Setups the widget.

detaileddescription.para: Numerous parameters control the position of the widget, the two scroll lists inside and the values in them.

parameterdescription.para: Number of drawables in outer array.
The callback to update a drawable.
Number of drawables in center array.
The callback to update a center drawable.

briefdescription.para: Sets drawables size.

detaileddescription.para: The drawable is is the size of each drawable in the list in the set direction of the list (this is enforced by the DrawableList class). The specified margin is added above and below each item for spacing. The entire size of an item is thus size + 2 * spacing.

For a horizontal list each element will be drawableSize high and have the same width as set using setWidth(). For a vertical list each element will be drawableSize wide and have the same height as set using setHeight().

parameterdescription.para: The size of the drawable.
The margin around drawables (margin before and margin after).

briefdescription.para: Sets the height of this drawable.

parameterdescription.para: The new height.

simplesect.para: For most Drawable widgets, changing this does normally not automatically yield a redraw.
Also sets the height of the children.

briefdescription.para: Sets a horizontal or vertical layout.

detaileddescription.para: If parameter horizontal is set true, all drawables are arranged side by side. If horizontal is set false, the drawables are arranged above and below each other (vertically).

parameterdescription.para: True to align drawables horizontal, false to align drawables vertically.

simplesect.para: Default value is false, i.e. vertical layout.

briefdescription.para: Sets number of items in the DrawableList.

detaileddescription.para: This forces all drawables to be updated to ensure that the content is correct. For example a date selector might switch number of days between 28, 29, 30, and 31 depending on the month. A circular list might show 27-28-29-30-31 and might need to update this to show 27-28-1-2-3.

parameterdescription.para: Number of items.

simplesect.para: The DrawableList is refreshed to reflect the change.

briefdescription.para: Sets selected item extra size to make the size of the area for the center drawables larger.

parameterdescription.para: The extra size before.
The extra size after.

briefdescription.para: Sets margin around selected item.

detaileddescription.para: This like an invisible area added before and after the selected item (including extra size).

parameterdescription.para: The margin before.
The margin after.

briefdescription.para: Sets selected item offset, measured in pixels, from the edge of the widget.

detaileddescription.para: The offset is the relative x coordinate if the ScrollWheel is horizontal, otherwise it is the relative y coordinate. If this value is zero, the selected item is placed at the very start of the widget.

parameterdescription.para: The offset.

memberdef.argsstring: (int16_t offset, int16_t extraSizeBefore, int16_t extraSizeAfter, int16_t marginBefore, int16_t marginAfter)
memberdef.name: setSelectedItemPosition

briefdescription.para: Sets the selected item offset.

detaileddescription.para: This is the distance from the beginning of the ScrollWheel measured in pixels. The distance before and after that should also be drawn using the center drawables - for example to extend area of emphasized elements - can also be specified. Further, if a gap is needed between the "normal" drawables and the center drawables - for example to give the illusion that that items disappear under a graphical element, only to appear in the center.
This is a combination of setSelectedItemOffset, setSelectedItemExtraSize and setSelectedItemMargin.

parameterdescription.para: The offset of the selected item.
The extra size before the selected item.
The extra size after the selected item.
The margin before the selected item.
The margin after the selected item.

briefdescription.para: Sets the width of this drawable.

parameterdescription.para: The new width.

simplesect.para: For most Drawable widgets, changing this does normally not automatically yield a redraw.
Also sets the width of the children.

briefdescription.para: Refresh drawable lists layout.

detaileddescription.para: Ensure that the three DrawableLists are places correctly and setup properly. This is typically done after the ScrollWheelWithSelectionStyle has been resized or the size of the selected item is changed.

briefdescription.para: Sets display offset of first item.

parameterdescription.para: The offset.

briefdescription.para: A scroll wheel is very much like the digit selector on a padlock with numbers.

detaileddescription.para: The digits always snap into place and exactly one number is always the "selected" number. Similar to an ordinary ScrollWheel, but with a different style for the selected item which can thus be bold, have a different color or similar effect to highlight it and help create a 3D effect using very few resources.
